meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from glycerol.
meanings.sent1: The glyceric solution was clear and odorless.
meanings.sent2: Her skin felt soft and glyceric after applying the lotion.
meanings.sent3: The glyceric cupcakes tasted sweet and refreshing.
meanings.sent4: The air in the room was filled with a glyceric scent.
meanings.sent5: The glyceric nature of the product made it stand out among the rest.

meanings.sent1: The glyceric substance had a smooth texture.
meanings.sent2: The soap left a glyceric residue on the hands.
meanings.sent3: The glyceric fabric felt cool against her skin.
meanings.sent4: The lake water had a glyceric sheen under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The glyceric appearance of the dessert made it look appetizing.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to glyceric acid.
meanings.sent1: The glyceric acid compound was used in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Her research focused on the glyceric acid levels in plants.
meanings.sent3: The scientist discovered a new glyceric acid derivative.
meanings.sent4: The medicine contained a trace amount of glyceric acid.
meanings.sent5: The glyceric acid solution reacted with the other chemicals in a unique way.
